content: beginning a row with a purl stitch as much as i do when doing your k2 p2 begin with a single k1 instead of k2 then when you get to the last 3 stitches k1 and move the last 2 stitches to the other needle now you ll always be beginning with a k1 and ending with a k1 your needles will actually be k1 p2 k1 5 egap bind off with jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind off or whatever stretchy bind off you are most comfortable doing a stretchy bind off is very important you definitely don t want to risk not being able to get your foot in after all this work below is another wonderful video by cat bordhi jssbo https //www youtube com/watch v=abbhe-jymgi weave in the ends and you are done well you re done with this one sock if you only made the one many of us suffer from second sock syndrome sss it s very real and there are different ways of battling it two at a time taat is how many people cope with this knit two socks at the same time on magic loop and you are done with both at the same time it s pretty cool if you haven t tried it i do subscribe to the two at a time method but for some reason i don t do it the normal cool taat way no no i have to be difficult and do it on separate needles as if i have two different projects going it works for me though a toe here then a toe over there a heel here then a heel over there lol hey we all find our own way to manage so if you didn t make both of your socks at the same time hurry up and get to that second sock now before the dreaded sss hits
